mads.note: His Iurisprudentia, 1991: PHI CD ROM #5.3, Latin Canon, bibliographic screen (M'. Manilius)

Pauly-Wissowa: 27. Halbbd., col. 1135-1139,"Manilius", #12 (M'. Manilius, mentioned as rendering legal opinions as an adolescent, before 169 B.C., praetor in Spain, 155 or 154 B.C., consul, 149 B.C., attempted to restrain Tiberius Gracchus from unconstitutional steps, 133 B.C.)

Oxford class. dict., 1st ed.: p. 533 (Manilius, Manius, famous jurist, one of the three founders of Roman civil law, praetor in Spain (155 or 154 B.C.), consul, 149 B.C., tried to check Tiberius Gracchus, 133 B.C.)
Dict. of Greek and Roman biog. and mythology, 1967: v. 2, p. 917-918 (M. Manilius, jurist, consul, 149 B.C.)
